description: French picorer (“to go marauding, originally to steal cattle”), ultimately from Latin pecoris (“cattle”).

verbs.description: pickeer (third-person singular simple present pickeers, present participle pickeering, simple past and past participle pickeered)

entries.meaning: (obsolete) To make a raid for booty; to maraud.
(obsolete) To skirmish in advance of an army.
